[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/debug.rs] [Access Control] Is there any mechanism preventing the DebugContext from being instantiated or used in production validator nodes, or can an attacker enable debugging on live blockchain execution? (Critical)

(Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/debug.rs] [Function: parse_number()] [Integer Overflow] Can an attacker provide extremely large numeric strings that cause integer overflow when parsed as usize, leading to unexpected behavior in step counters? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/debug.rs] [Function: parse_number()] [Edge Case] Does parse_number() handle whitespace-only input correctly by defaulting to 1, and could malicious whitespace patterns bypass intended validation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/debug.rs] [Function: from_str()] [Input Validation] Can an attacker craft malformed command strings with special characters or escape sequences that cause panics or undefined behavior in the FromStr parser? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/debug.rs] [Function: from_str()] [String Handling] Does the strip_prefix() logic properly validate that breakpoint strings are sanitized, or could null bytes or format string exploits be injected? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/debug.rs] [Function: debug_loop()] [Resource Exhaustion] Can an attacker add unlimited breakpoints to the BTreeSet, causing memory exhaustion and DoS on the validator node? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/debug.rs] [Struct: DebugContext] [State Manipulation] Can breakpoints be set on critical system functions or consensus logic to pause execution at specific points, enabling timing attacks or state inspection? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/debug.rs] [Function: debug_loop()] [Breakpoint Logic] Does the breakpoint matching logic using starts_with() allow overly broad pattern matching that could trigger on unintended instructions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/debug.rs] [Function: debug_loop()] [DeleteBreakpoint] Is there proper validation that DeleteBreakpoint commands only remove existing breakpoints, or could malformed delete commands cause unexpected state changes? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/debug.rs] [Function: debug_loop()] [Information Leakage] When PrintStack command is executed, does it expose complete call stacks including private function details that could reveal internal Move VM implementation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/debug.rs] [Function: debug_loop()] [Locals Inspection] Does printing local variables expose sensitive data like account balances, private transaction details, or cryptographic material in memory? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/debug.rs] [Function: debug_loop()] [Code Inspection] Can an attacker use the debug interface to inspect bytecode of privileged system modules or framework contracts to find vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/debug.rs] [Function: debug_loop()] [StepOut] If stack_depth reaches 0 unexpectedly, does the target_stack_depth subtraction (stack_depth - 1) cause integer underflow? (Medium)
